column3: Small nit: let's call it "User agent" instead of "Client subversion". I can see "subversion" resulting in quite funny translations, and more people will understand it by comparing it to HTTP user agent (that's also why we use option `-uacomment`)\n
Do we need starting and trailing `/` in Client version and User agent/Client subversion at all?\n
IMO, yes. Don't try to be smart and just report as it is sent to the P2P network.\n
+1 for `User Agent` (The Peers-tab in the debug window already calls it that way)\n
Tested ACK. +1 for user agent.
